text.0: though indra thou art called by men eastward and westward north and south.
text.1: thou chiefly art with Ānava and turvaśa brave champion i urged by men to come.
text.2: or indra when with ruma ruśama Śyāvaka and kṛpa thou rejoicest thee.
text.3: still do the kaṇvas bringing praises with their prayers o indra draw thee hither come.
text.4: even as the wildbull when he thirsts goes to the deserts watery pool.
text.5: come hither quickly both at morning and at eve and with the kaṇvas drink thy fill.
text.6: may the drops gladden thee rich indra and obtain bounty for him who pours the juice.
text.7: soma pressed in the mortar didst thou take and drink and hence hast won surpassing might.
text.8: with mightier strength he conquered strength with energy he crushed their wrath.
text.9: o indra strong in youth all those who sought the fray bent and bowed down to thee like trees.
text.10: he who wins promise of thine aid goes girt as with a thousand mighty men of war.
text.11: he makes his son preeminent in hero might he serves with reverential prayer.
text.12: with thee the mighty for our friend we will not fear or feel fatigue.
text.13: may we see turvaśa and yadu thy great deed o hero must be glorified.
text.14: on his left hip the hero hath reclined himself the proffered feast offends him not.
text.15: the milk is blended with the honey of the bee quickly come hither baste and drink.
text.16: indra thy friend is fair of form and rich in horses cars and kine.
text.17: he evermore hath food accompanied by wealth and radiant joins the company.
text.18: come like a thirsty antelope to the drinkingplace drink soma to thy hearts desire.
text.19: raining it down o maghavan day after day thou gainest thy surpassing might.
text.20: priest let the soma juice flow forth for indra longs to drink thereof.
text.21: he even now hath yoked his vigorous bay steeds the vṛtraslayer hath come near.
text.22: the man with whom thou fillcst thee with soma deems himself a pious worshipper.
text.23: this thine appropriate food is here poured out for thee come hasten forward drink of it.
text.24: press out the soma juice ye priests for indra borne upon his car.
text.25: the pressingstones speak loud of indra while they shed the juice which offered honours him.
text.26: to the brown juice may his dear vigorous bay steeds bring indra to our holy task.
text.27: hither let thy carsteeds who seek the sacrifice bring thee to our drinkofferings.
text.28: pūṣan the lord of ample wealth for firm alliance we elect.
text.29: may he with wisdom Śakra looser muchinvoked aid us to riches and to seed.
text.30: sharpen us like a razor in the barbers hands send riches thou who settest free.
text.31: easy to find with thee are treasures of the dawn for mortal man whom thou dost speed.
text.32: pūṣan i long to win thy love i long to praise thee radiant god.
text.33: excellent lord tis strange tome no wish have i to sing the psalm that pajra sings.
text.34: my kine o radiant god seek pasture where they will my during wealth immortal one.
text.35: be our protector pūṣan be most liberal lord propitious to our gathering strength.
text.36: rich was the gift kurunga gave a hundred steeds at morning rites.
text.37: among the gifts of turvaśas we thought of him the opulent the splendid king.
text.38: what by his morning songs kaṇva the powerful hath with the priyamedhas gained.
text.39: the herds of sixty thousand pure and spotless kine have i the Ṛṣi driven away.
text.40: the very trees were joyful at my coming kine they obtained in plenty steeds in plenty.
